item.dc:creator: @roflcopterofl roflcopterofl
item.description:
@roflcopterofl wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:23, topic:317513”][quote author=roflcopterofl link=topic=414032.msg3050650#msg3050650 date=1260060039]

if someone actually made that with a landscape editor, props to them, would be so time consuming.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 05, 2009, 06:25:56 am[/size][hr]sorry to steal your thunder, but i spent a couple of hours into writing a .jag & .mem > .rscd format converter, it’s not complete as i really gotta get sleep (and was harder than i expected), but will be finished tomorrow. (always wanted to have tutorial island for RSCA, i should have looked into it earlier.)

lol why did you make it for. You should have go and got the tutorial island out of the old RSCD v23 i think it was. thats what i did

[/quote]
i could have sworn i went through all the RSCD v16 - v25 landscape files and didn’t see it.[/quote]
No it’s for sure in there. Go fetch that download link from you post. Go into rscd v23 i think it is. Go into the conf folder. Bam a landscape file. rename landscape.rscd to landscape.rar and then extract it. Then fild the sector of the tutorial island. Copy it and put it in you current landscape. Everythings there except you have to put the npcs in but that is no problem =)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 06, 2009, 09:18:02 am[/size][hr][quote=“roflcopterofl”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=414032.msg3050657#msg3050657 date=1260060324]

if someone actually made that with a landscape editor, props to them, would be so time consuming.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 05, 2009, 06:25:56 am[/size][hr]sorry to steal your thunder, but i spent a couple of hours into writing a .jag & .mem > .rscd format converter, it’s not complete as i really gotta get sleep (and was harder than i expected), but will be finished tomorrow. (always wanted to have tutorial island for RSCA, i should have looked into it earlier.)

lol why did you make it for. You should have go and got the tutorial island out of the old RSCD v23 i think it was. thats what i did

i could have sworn i went through all the RSCD v16 - v25 landscape files and didn’t see it.
[/quote]
No it’s for sure in there. Go fetch that download link from your post. Go into rscd v23 i think it is. Go into the conf folder. Bam a landscape file. rename landscape.rscd to landscape.rar and then extract it. Then fild the sector of the tutorial island. Copy it and put it in you current landscape. Everythings there except you have to put the npcs in but that is no problem =)[/quote]

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @snoopy89 snoopy89
item.description:
@snoopy89 wrote:

[quote=“Kryptix, post:1, topic:317513”]As far as I know (and have been told) this has never been done before.

I’m about half way through writing the NPC handlers and all the checks, but as I’m replicating it 100% it’s more like a quest but it wouldn’t work with any current quest system. It’s programmed very strangely and difficult to explain unless you walk round the tutorial island yourself trying all sorts of weird combinations.

I even stood watching each NPC on RSC’s Tutorial Island to see how far they would roam.

PS. I forgot the chickens in the screenshot. :rolleyes:[/quote]

Tobad people can rip it of from the client, otherwise looks good.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Motaro Motaro
item.description:
@Motaro wrote:

[quote=“KO9, post:8, topic:317513”][quote author=T X LOL link=topic=414032.msg3049821#msg3049821 date=1260021302]
@KO9

Writing your own jag unpacker and then then saving the landscape files of the current rsc landscape format to rscd landscape format is a advantage for your server. because the current runescape classic uses the same jag compression as the old versions, so xEnt can upgrade the server maps with the lastest runescape maps without creating it yourself. so it is a good idea what xEnt is doing, may take alot longer time but its better in the long run
[/quote]
Going to be so useful, seeing as JaGeX is going to be updating runescape classic’s landscape…[/quote]

What do you mean?

Read full topic

item.description:

Writing your own jag unpacker and then then saving the landscape files of the current rsc landscape format to rscd landscape format is a advantage for your server. because the current runescape classic uses the same jag compression as the old versions, so xEnt can upgrade the server maps with the lastest runescape maps without creating it yourself. so it is a good idea what xEnt is doing, may take alot longer time but its better in the long run[/quote]
